Introduction
Lars Bejder is the Director of the Marine Mammal Research Program at the Hawaii Institute of Marine Biology at the University of Hawaii. He has studied various aspects of cetacean biology, ecology and conservation in New Zealand, Australia and US. He has published > 120 peer-reviewed journal articles and book chapters on cetaceans (impacts of human activity; fundamental biology and ecology; statistical methods to analyse complex social structures).
